title: How to Make a Wireless Antenna

steps.headline: Grab some solder (preferably thick) or some bendy wire/solder and wrap it around the point of a thumbtack.
steps.description: this will provide you with a small loop about that same size as the inner 'pin' on the back of your wireless card.

steps.headline: Bend the wire at a 90 degree angle just under the loop you just created.
steps.description: this will allow for easy insertion when you place it around the inner 'pin'

steps.headline: Place the wire around the pin, and wrap the remaining wire around the outside 'threads' where you would normally screw in the antenna.
Insert the thumbtack in between the inner 'pin' and the small loop you made.
steps.description: this is to ensure the inner pin is always in contact with the solder.

steps.headline: The other end of the wire/solder can be wrapped around any cable from the back of your computer to enhance wireless reception.

text: Grab some solder (preferably thick) or some bendy wire/solder and wrap it around the point of a thumbtack. this will provide you with a small loop about that same size as the inner 'pin' on the back of your wireless card. Bend the wire at a 90 degree angle just under the loop you just created. this will allow for easy insertion when you place it around the inner 'pin' Place the wire around the pin, and wrap the remaining wire around the outside 'threads' where you would normally screw in the antenna.  Insert the thumbtack in between the inner 'pin' and the small loop you made. this is to ensure the inner pin is always in contact with the solder. The other end of the wire/solder can be wrapped around any cable from the back of your computer to enhance wireless reception.

this will provide you with a small loop about that same size as the inner 'pin' on the back of your wireless card.
Bend the wire at a 90 degree angle just under the loop you just created.

this will allow for easy insertion when you place it around the inner 'pin' Place the wire around the pin, and wrap the remaining wire around the outside 'threads' where you would normally screw in the antenna.
Insert the thumbtack in between the inner 'pin' and the small loop you made.
this is to ensure the inner pin is always in contact with the solder.
The other end of the wire/solder can be wrapped around any cable from the back of your computer to enhance wireless reception.
